Description: Terracotta mould-made figure of woman being molested by a man or satyr. White coating preserved on some areas. Pale red-brown fabric with common fine mica, quartz, grey (rounded), black and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably an East Greek relief plaque of Hellenistic date. See Naukratis joining fragments NA371, NA372, NA376 and NA813 also in Cambridge that are similar in style and subject. A Hellensitic East Greek example from Myrina was dated to the 2nd century BC (Mollard-Besques 1963, pl.190 CA 1632; pl.177, MYR 195, MYR 690 ) Mollard-Besques, S. 1963. Catalogue raisonnédes figurines et reliefs en terre-cuite Grecs et Romains II, Myrina. Paris, Musée National du Louvre.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.382) (Phase 1)
Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 83, no. 71)
